title: Whiteboard Friday - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Shannon McGuirk April 9, 2021 Debunking Link Building Myths in 2021 Whiteboard Friday | Link Building On this week’s episode of Whiteboard Friday, guest host and MozCon speaker Shannon McGuirk walks through five link building myths prevalent in 2021, and why you shouldn’t believe them. Read this post By: Britney Muller April 2, 2021 How to Get Backlinks in 2021 [Series Part 3: Outreach] Link Building | Whiteboard Friday Join guest host Britney Muller in the third and final installment of her link building series, as she walks through the do's and don’ts of link building outreach in 2021. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard March 26, 2021 7 Actually Smart Tips to Reduce Bounce Rate Whiteboard Friday | SEO Analytics Is a high bounce rate bad? The answer is: it depends, but yes, sometimes it can be. Is a high bounce rate bad for SEO? That’s where it gets a little more complicated. In this week’s episode of Whiteboard Friday, Cyrus gives you seven easy SEO tips to address your bounce rate, and increase engagement and satisfaction to make your users happier. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers March 19, 2021 Every Metric Is A Vanity Metric SEO Analytics | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Reporting Marketers can get caught up in specific metrics, focusing on those data points that make you look good in reporting, but don’t help you understand your performance. In this week’s episode of Whiteboard Friday, Dr. Pete discusses the vanity we bring to the metrics we track, and how to take a better, more realistic view of your results. Read this post By: Cody McDaniel March 12, 2021 How to Select Meaningful B2B SEO Keywords Keyword Research | On-page SEO | Whiteboard Friday It’s no secret that B2B marketing is different than B2C. The sales cycle is longer, there are multiple stakeholders involved, and it’s usually more expensive. To market effectively, you need to create content that helps, educates, and informs your clientele. The best way to do that is to identify the keywords that matter most to them, and build out content accordingly. Read this post By: Meghan Pahinui March 5, 2021 How to Resolve Duplicate Content On-page SEO | Moz Tools | Whiteboard Friday Duplicate content is a pretty common issue, and it can often be a bit confusing. What is it? How is it determined? Why are certain pages on my site being flagged as duplicates? And most importantly, how do I resolve these issues? Find the answers to all these questions and more in this week’s Whiteboard Friday! Read this post By: Greg Gifford February 26, 2021 Google Posts: Conversion Factor — Not Ranking Factor Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | Local SEO While Google Posts aren’t a ranking factor, they can still be an incredibly effective resource for increasing local business conversions — when used correctly. This week’s Whiteboard Friday host, Greg Gifford, shows you how to put your best post forward. Read this post By: Carly Schoonhoven February 12, 2021 Impactful SEO Audits for B2B Whiteboard Friday | Technical SEO | Competitive Research A comprehensive audit of your B2B website can mean the difference between winning new clients and losing them to the competition. In this brand new episode of Whiteboard Friday, guest host Carly Schoonhoven walks you through four areas that can take your audits to the next level. Read this post By: Zoe Pegler February 5, 2021 Using STAT to Identify Featured Snippet Opportunities SEO Tools | Moz Tools | Whiteboard Friday Moz Learning and Development Specialist, Zoe Pegler, walks you through how you can use STAT to win featured snippets in five easy steps. Read this post By: Amanda Milligan January 29, 2021 The Anatomy of the Perfect Pitch Email Whiteboard Friday | Content Marketing | Link Building If you need to get backlinks and generate brand awareness for clients, a great way to start is by creating original research and then pitching that research to writers. But the promotion of your work is probably the trickiest part, and a lot of it comes down to the pitch email you send to a writer. To make this task a bit less daunting, in this episode of Whiteboard Friday, Amanda Milligan of Fractl walks you through a real pitch email that resulted in coverage of one of their stories. Read this post By: Garrett French January 22, 2021 A (Re)Introduction to Guest Posting Link Building | Whiteboard Friday | Content Marketing Garrett French — founder of Citation Labs and all around link building expert — takes you on a comprehensive walkthrough of guest posting on sites supported by sales. Why is this a good strategy? How do your posts benefit these websites? How do you start and what websites do you reach out to? Watch to find out! Read this post By: Jo Cameron January 15, 2021 Investigating Traffic Upticks SEO Analytics | Moz Tools | Whiteboard Friday Jo Cameron, Moz’s Learning Team Manager, talks through the journey you begin when you notice a sudden change in traffic to a particular page on your site, including how to determine where traffic is coming from and what to do with the increased attention. Read this post By: Joyce Collardé December 18, 2020 SEO Competitive Analysis for B2B — Whiteboard Friday Whiteboard Friday | Competitive Research In our last Whiteboard Friday episode before 2021, guest presenter Joyce Collardé of Obility walks you through how to conduct a competitive SEO audit, helping you address your improvement areas and surpass your competition in the SERPs. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 11, 2020 3 Creative Ways to Give Your Content Efforts a Boost — Best of Whiteboard Friday Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Basics We know that content is our doorway to earning countless SEO benefits for our sites. Admittedly, though, it’s too easy to get stuck in a rut after one too many content marketing campaigns. In this 2017 holiday edition of Whitebeard Friday (see what we did there?), Rand offers three novel ways to add sparkle to your content creation efforts. Read this post
